tutorial.title:
Internal Rate of Return (IRR)
of a Series of Cash Flows
tutorial.scenario:
Healthtime has the opportunity to make an investment that requires an initial cash outflow of $6,500. The estimates cash inflows from the project for the next six years are shown below. What is the IRR on this investment?

Play
tutorial.step: Press the RESET button to clear all the previous entries. Then, press the CF button to access the Cash Flow mode.
Enter the initial cash outflow (in this case 6500), and then press the +/- button.
Press the ENTER button to store this as the initial cash investment.
Press ↓, enter the first cash inflow amount (in this case 1000), and then press the ENTER button to store this cash flow amount.
Press ↓. Then, press 2 followed by the ENTER button to record that (in this case) the cash inflow of 1000 occurs twice.
Press ↓, enter the second cash inflow amount (in this case 900), and then press the ENTER button to store this cash flow amount.
Press ↓. Then, press 2 followed by the ENTER button to record that (in this case) the cash inflow of 900 occurs twice.
Press ↓, enter the third cash inflow amount (in this case 750), and then press the ENTER button to store this cash flow amount.
Press ↓ to show that (in this case) the cash inflow of 750 occurs only once.
Press ↓, enter the final cash inflow (in this case 60000), and then press the ENTER button to store the final cash inflow.
Press the CPT button and then the IRR button to calculate the internal rate of return for this investment.
